channel.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
channel.description:
From some research, this car goes from 0-25 in 12 seconds. I have also seen one going about 110MPH, so i know its not really slow for its size/shape. What do you think?
[img]http://images.paultan.org/images/Tata_Nano_13.jpg[/img]

item.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:25, topic:350928”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=447280.msg3282996#msg3282996 date=1280001245]

Not according to wikipedia

You need to have your license, yet be at least 14 and get your learners to actually know how a car works legally, text doesn’t always prove as an answer.

You get your learners at 14? Fml I had to wait until i was 16

Haha, americans…

I’m Australian
[/quote]gf.
so tis 14 for uk i believe?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:12, topic:350928”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=447280.msg3282813#msg3282813 date=1279990252]

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=447280.msg3282810#msg3282810 date=1279990039]

From some research, this car goes from 0-25 in 12 seconds. I have also seen one going about 110MPH, so i know its not really slow for its size/shape. What do you think?

[/quote]0-25 in 12 seconds is slow as fuck, I hope you know that…

Now here’s an different car to be interested in:

It depends on what angle you are looking at it. My car goes from 1-25 in about 2 seconds, but also tops out at 85 or at least that’s when i don’t see my needle anymore. Sure, my car is not fast, but, I would rather have top-speed, rather than get up speed.
[/quote]You top out further than your needle can go. Also, wtf are you driving. I have a dodge neon, and it’s horrid on speed, but I’ve gotten to 120…?[/quote]
Since my sports car is about 1200 miles away, with my parents, I drive a Murcury Topaz. Not the best looking car, but it gets great mileage, and the price was right for its condition. (Appraised at about $3k-4k for sell), and I got it for title transfer and 2 oil changed on a guys car.

Read full topic
item.source: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!

item.source: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!

item.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:350928”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=447280.msg3282782#msg3282782 date=1279989061]

Look at it. That’s the reason. I don’t enjoy driving matchboxes. The concept of a cheap car however is excellent.
[/quote]
See, you admit, the car in concept is great, but the design is ugly. I feel the same way, and thank you for the reason, I now have a bit more respect for ya.

@'Aaron - To get a cheep car, you HAVE to cut down on options. You must make sacrifices to get some things. For example, Plastic body over metal, sure, its not as strong, and its cheaper, but it does cut the cost of the over-all car.[/quote]

I really don’t give a shit how the car looks as long as it gets me from A to B.

It’s barely legal in India, and wouldn’t be legal in Canada or the United States.

Imagine not being able to go past 65Mph on the highway. I wouldn’t doubt it if the company CEO drives a sports car with the logo of Tato Nano.

This really is the cheapest car, but it’s sure a piece of shit.

Read full topic
item.source: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!

item.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Cutting down the cost can easily effect safety on each vehicle. Those wheels also look like they were removed from a bicycle. If a cost friendly vehicle were to be introduced which included the same safety features as a normal car, it would be a popular buy.

Read full topic

@'Aaron - To get a cheep car, you HAVE to cut down on options. You must make sacrifices to get some things. For example, Plastic body over metal, sure, its not as strong, and its cheaper, but it does cut the cost of the over-all car.

item.source: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!

item.title: Tata Nano? Alleged worlds cheepest car!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:4, topic:350928”]

Look at it. That’s the reason. I don’t enjoy driving matchboxes. The concept of a cheap car however is excellent.[/quote]

The car is completely terrible, we did a school project once on the car, it’s built in India as a cheap alternative

[center][size=14pt]Cost cutting features[/size][/center]

[size=8pt][center]The Nano’s trunk does not open. Instead, the rear seats can be folded down to access the boot.
One windscreen wiper instead of the usual pair.
No power steering, though it is unnecessary due to Nano’s light weight body.
Three lug nuts on the wheels instead of the usual four.
Only one side view mirror on the base model.
Some use of plastic and glue in rear hatch which cannot be opened.
Manually operated side windows on base model
HVAC not part of base model
Airbags not part of base model
The 623cc engine has only 2 cylinders, much smaller output than other cars, but adequate for city driving.
Use of central instrument cluster.
ABS not fitted to base model.[/center][/size]

@Coonhunter, the maximum speed the Nano can go is 105 km/h (65 mph)

Read full topic
